sentences.english: Bentham sums up two principles that are applicable to penalty.
sentences.chinese: 邊沁歸納出了刑罰適用的兩個基本原則。

sentences.english: Under this background, the reform of non-penalization in china is being put on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 在這一背景下，中國的非刑罰化改革也被提上日程。

sentences.english: Part four, the relation between the principle of suiting punishment to crime and the criminal individualization.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，罪刑均衡原則與刑罰個別化的關係。

sentences.english: He sent His sinless Son to bear the full brunt of the penalty we deserved to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 他差派他無罪的兒子承擔我們應該遭受的全部刑罰。

sentences.english: But those who reject our signs, - them shall punishment touch, for that they ceased not from transgressing .
sentences.chinese: 否認我的跡象的人，將爲犯罪而遭受刑罰。

sentences.english: And last, the punishment application of contract swindles .
sentences.chinese: 四是合同詐騙罪的刑罰適用。

sentences.english: Australians generally believe that Corby is innocent and the punishment is too severe.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲人普遍認爲科爾比是無辜，而且刑罰過重。

sentences.english: In a wide sense of the word, criminology includes penology.
sentences.chinese: 從廣義上講，犯罪學包括刑罰學。

sentences.english: For fear has to do with punishment, and whoever fears has not reached perfection in love.
sentences.chinese: 因爲懼怕裏含着刑罰，懼怕的人在愛裏未得完全。

sentences.english: Secondly, the criminal penalty system of gambling crime should be improved.
sentences.chinese: 二是從賭博罪的刑罰體系方面進行完善。

sentences.english: The scientific theory should be the theory of unification theory.
sentences.chinese: 刑罰正當根據學說之科學立論是統一論。

sentences.english: The theory of criminology is the scientific foundation of mitigation of punishment.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪學理論的發展爲刑罰輕緩化提供了科學實證根據。

sentences.english: O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment;
sentences.chinese: 耶和華阿，你派定他爲要刑罰人。

sentences.english: In addition, more attention should be paid to the application of non-criminal punishments.
sentences.chinese: 另外，還應當注重非刑罰措施的適用。

sentences.english: The water torture was a favorite among Japanese POW guards during WWII.
sentences.chinese: 水刑是二戰時期日本戰俘守衛最喜歡的一種刑罰。
是耶穌承當了所有“轉賬”的刑罰。

definition: to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
